title: (x) Stochastic Analysis And Applications - Jay Gothic {Ignacio}
content: ... Jay Gothic [Regular](http://web.archive.org/web/20050817211221/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/urw/jay-gothic/urw-t-regular/testdrive.html?s=Stochastic+Analysis+and+App&p=48) with that "t" or [Bold](http://web.archive.org/web/20050817211221/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/urw/jay-gothic/urw-t-bold/testdrive.html?s=Stochastic+Analysis+and+App&p=48) without that "t"? (!)
author: Ignacio

comments.content: Good catch Ignacio. I'd vote for the regular with a little added stroke thickness.(I referred him here, because the best I could suggest was [Fiedler Gothic Bold](http://web.archive.org/web/20050817211221/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/agfa/atfiedler-gothic-bold/?PREFS_SET%5BRenderSize%5D=24&PREFS_SET%5BRenderString%5D=Stochastic%20Analysis%20and%20Applications) from Agfa)
